Package pack1

Class CSV2HTML

java.lang.Object
pack1.CSV2HTML
public class CSV2HTML extends Object
This class contains the main method as well as the core engine for processing the input files and creating the output files.

  • Method Details

    • convertCSVtoHTML

      private static void convertCSVtoHTML(String[] filesNames, Scanner[] readers, PrintWriter[] pws, PrintWriter eLog)
      This method is the core engine of the CSV2HTML tool. It takes in an array of CSV input files and convert each of them to their corresponding html output file, while validating if all of their contents are there.
      Parameters:
      filesNames -
      readers -
      pws -
      eLog -

    • checkMissingAttribute

      private static void checkMissingAttribute(String file, PrintWriter eLog) throws CSVAttributeMissing
      This method handles the error of missing attributes by throwing it back to the convertCSVtoHTML, so it can catch it.
      Parameters:
      file -
      eLog -
      Throws:
      CSVAttributeMissing

    • isDataValid

      private static void isDataValid(String[] data, int j, String fileName, int rowNumb, String attribute, PrintWriter eLog, int numbAttributes) throws CSVDataMissing
      This method handles the error of missing data by throwing it back to the convertCSVtoHTML, so it can catch it.
      Parameters:
      data -
      j -
      fileName -
      rowNumb -
      attribute -
      eLog -
      numbAttributes -
      Throws:
      CSVDataMissing

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      This is the main method that starts the program by prompting the user to enter the names of the input files. It then tries to open the input, output, exception files. If these files cannot be opened, or they encounter an error, it will be handled within this main method. Once these files have been opened, the main method calls the convertCSVtoHTML method to convert the files. At the end it will call the method displayOutputFile to display a file to the screen.
      Parameters:
      args -

    • verifyInput

      private static boolean verifyInput(File csvFile, Scanner csvReader, PrintWriter eLog)
      This method returns true if the input file exists and if it can be read, it returns false and prints an error message otherwise.
      Parameters:
      csvFile -
      csvReader -
      eLog -
      Returns:
      boolean

    • verifyOutput

      private static boolean verifyOutput(File htmlFile, PrintWriter eLog)
      This method returns true if the output file exists and if it can be written, it returns false and prints an error message otherwise.
      Parameters:
      htmlFile -
      eLog -
      Returns:
      boolean

    • cleanUp

      private static void cleanUp(PrintWriter htmlPw, Scanner csvReader, PrintWriter eLog)
      This method cleans up the program in case of an output file error. It closes all the open input and output files, as well as deletes any created output files.
      Parameters:
      htmlPw -
      csvReader -
      eLog -

    • displayOutputFile

      private static void displayOutputFile()
      This method allows the user to choose an output file they wish to see on the screen. Once the file has been chosen, using the buffered reader to read the file, it will output onto the screen, the html file.
